Posts.Content: I am experiencing severe bloating and read about the ascites I am stage 4 breast cance mets in liver can anyone give me insight how dangerous is this if I wait to see my onc  in two weeks? Thank you Susan
Posts.Title: ascites

Posts.Content: Ten years the mam did show a small cancerous tumor (lucky for me early detetection) had the lump removed and under radiation for 6 weeks. Two years ago the mam looked wonderful, even though I experinced off and on breast pain, later doctor ordered ultra sound, still no suspicios evidents. My intuition was so, so right I now am stage 4 with mets in liver and bone. It was the MRI machine that detected the hidden tumor under my scar tissues.  I learned about my stage 4 in June of 2010  I have a positive attitude and believe I will be around alot longer than one or two years from now. I am on Famara and receiving monthly IV of Zometa I would also like to hear from others like me.
Posts.Title: Did anyone's cancer NOT show up on Mammogram or Ultrasound?

Posts.Content: On Mar 26, 2009 12:00 AM Ryalma wrote: Would like to know the life expectancy on the above type of cancer. Also, if anyone has had treatments at Oasis of Hope in Mexico and how effective the treatment has been.  Many thanks I was diagnosed , June 2010 recurrent breast cancer stage 4 mass to bone in lower back and liver.  In 2008 I requested a sonogram because the mamo didn't see anything suspicious (I been having brast pain off and on d=for a while. My first diagnosis brease cancer, lumpectomy and radiation.  InThis yr. late may 2010 an MRI discovered hte 3cm tumor; not the ammo or sonogram. This is scary to me. My oncoloist said the the cancer must have been in my body for some time.  I am taking Femera and Zometa IV infusion monthly. I also drink 3oz 3 x'x a day of Essiac Tea whick has cured many cnacers and other ailments. I have started this regime -Fermara, Iv infusion last week for the first time and my Teas since July 15th and can feel energy.  I would love to accept an job offer , however, someone said the stress of staff turn overwuld be too much for me due to my condition. It is in the healthcare industry . What are your thoughts about stress / work. I alwayds believe it was our choice to pick up stress? I would love to communicate with someone out there. Thank you, Suzanne
Posts.Title: Stage IV breast cancer spread to liver and bones

Posts.Content: Dear Anna, I really appreciate your testimony and will follow your courseline. I am drinking essiac tea which is proving to me new positive effects after two week . I drink 3oz  three x's a day. This tea is has detoxification herbs (8 herbs) Letter of authenticity from Dr. Charles Bausch, M.D.  There are many ,many testimonies of cures. Google it. I actually feel more energy, a lot less pain in my joints!!! Thank you again for your note. Susan
Posts.Title: Stage IV breast cancer spread to liver and bones

Posts.Content: It is now 13 months since I recieved the news from my doctor that I am in stage 4. I been having success with the drug Famera. My marker number is at 29; any number below 38 is good. Yeterday my visit with the Onc. said that Famera will one day not be effective, possibly in six motnhs I may have to go on another drug. The Mets have gone into the liver and parts of the backbone. my next scans will be scheduled before Sept. 2011 I have been so extremely positive and believe attitude and being mobile are both healers.  The last scan didn't see mets in liver. Does anyone else out there with stage 4 noticed mets disappearing from sites; liver, bone, etc... I llok forward to your comments. Thank you, Susan

My question  is how dangerous is to be on chemo ? A year? What negatives are there for internal organs re; to chemo? Any response would be appreciated! Susan

Posts.Title: When to no longer receive chemo

Posts.Content: In June 2010 diagnose with recurrent breast cancer /2 leasons in liver (cancer) and hot spots in bone-spinal areas I received a call from my onc colleague's nurse who called me out of the clear blue to announce that Dr. BOr...onc. read my scan and not cancer to the bone/ nothing I was estatic and thought it was strange that my onc dr. cop. did give me thie report.  My appt. with my onc. dr. cop  told her about that wonderful call from her Colleague -she was miffed and said I have cancer i the bone and she had no right to give you her opinion. My question is when a scan shows hot spots is that an indicator for metasis on the bone or in the bone Is there a difference(in the bone or 0n the Bone)? I am on Zometa to keep the back bone strong By, the way, this pass week had my scans (CT & Body Scan ) the report said no findings  in the liver /Its gone!!! What is your impression//
Posts.Title: Question about mets to the spine

Posts.Content: On Dec 02, 2011 7:09 PM Johnr_1 wrote: On Dec 02, 2011 3:01 PM smoser wrote: I am stage 4 breast recurrent cancer. I was on taxotere 5 rounds and received terrible sideeffects It cooked my skin, now on now on gemso  two weeks on one week off and feel better. My question  is how dangerous is to be on chemo ? A year? What negatives are there for internal organs re; to chemo? Any response would be appreciated! Susan I am a 4 time Lung Cancer survivor. I have had over 35 chemos of Taxol, Carbo/Cisplatin, and Alimta. 2 major lung surgeries, over 40 CT and Pet Scans and over 600 needles and IV's and 28 Radiation treatments to the neck. And right now i am all clear over the 12 years i have been doing this. Naturopathic things have their place and i have used them (maybe 10 to 15% of what i do) but they are not a substitute for Surgery, Chemo and Radiation. Here are all my personal notes:   http://liveforeverwithcancer.com/ "" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://liveforeverwithcancer.com/ " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://liveforeverwithcancer.com/   My Best to You Johnr_1 Thank you John and so happy for your valient fight You are a remarkable person and appreciate your note to me! Susan
Posts.Title: When to no longer receive chemo

Posts.Content: On Jan 31, 2011 2:48 PM JoyceJJL wrote: I started taking  Glucosamine?Chrondroitin   4 days ago, with the ok from my Dr.  I could not stand the bone & joint pain any longer.  I read someones post on here a few weeks ago about taking it.  They take 500mg 3 times a day. However the only one I could find was 1500, so I asked my Dr and she said take 1 pill a day.  Now whether its someone up above helping me or the pills I dont know,.  But I am beginning to feel less pain.  I admit there is still alot of bone & joint pain still there,.  But not like it was and its only been 4 days taking this.  However I do make sure I take it with a  meal. As she mentioned to take food with it.  I have Gerd, maybe thats why.  But ask your Dr many amny people have mentioned this outside since I said I was taking it, and they agreed it would help joint pain.  I pray this helps someone.  Thank you to the person who got me on it. Joyce Hi Joyce, I can now get up at 6 am without a lot of knee/joint pain because of this great supplement. I on taking Femara which the side effect being joint pain in knees, toes fingers, etc. I can now go downstairs at 6:10 am to feed my animals without the dread. keep taking it . I know I have been faithful to this supplement for three weeks now, and yes take it with your meal.  I have recurrent breast cnacer- stage 4 - dx in June 2010 Cancer growth is so silent. My annual mams for the ten yrs never spotted the tumor. Life goes on... Susan
Posts.Title: Glucosamine/Chrondroitin

Posts.Content: On Jan 17, 2011 9:18 PM AmandaJD wrote: I too have regular tumour markers done - mine are the CA 15.3, but in my form of cancer these markers are unreliable as my cancer is a nonsecreter. The specialists get into action when your levels are at 30 or higher, but up until that point, they can fluctuate depending on how you are feeling at the time.  My oncologist relates it to being a butterfly in a bottle, it can drift up and then down without staying in one place.  If you are stressed (and who wouldnt be at a time like you are going through) they can read higher ( I had this happen when my son was critically ill), but the best barometer is how you are actually feeling.  Always relate how you are even if you think something is silly, it may not be. Let them know if you are having night sweats, any aches or pains or changes in how something feels.  It all gives them a comprehensive picture to work with.  Take care and my thoughts are with you - remember only you know how you really feel.  Love Amanda In June 2010 diagnois/ recurrrent breast cancer stage 4 Marker was at 162 now as of 1/13 2011 onc. said marker is at 23!!!! 1/12/2011 had another bone scan and CT on the 13th of Jan. met with onc good news no show of mts in my liver (it was there in June) bone is not any worst/same. I will start pilates and remain/diet alot of berries, wild berry smothie, less red meat, stay awy from milk ccancer cells love mucus and guided imagaging is your arsenal to keep you refuel on positive energy. Also taking a supplement named Glucosamine for advance bone and joint suppport supplement 2x's aday with food I am on Fermara and monthly infusion of Zometa When I first learned about my recurrence/stage 4 I drank a herbal mix from Canada (100 yr old recipe) for six weeks 3 x's a day @ 3 ounces each time. It totlaly detoxified my body It is called ESSIAC look it up on the internet Amazing stuff. My Onc advise me not to continue. She is traditional doctor.  I have a hunch it is a combination of the above that lowvered my number to mid 20's (almost a miracle  A miracle is no trace of caner in my liver) I had two leasions detected in june biopsy/ now gone. Susan
Posts.Title: Cancer "Markers"??

Posts.Content: I have mets the pine/so far no pain After my chemo I have to place ice on anklesand/swell like elephant feet anyone out there experiencing this?
Posts.Title: swelling of the ankles

Posts.Content: On Jan 15, 2011 7:20 PM aerick54 wrote: I have Infiltrating Ductal Carcinoma stage 1, grade 2.  I have had a lumpectomy and radiation, and have been taking femara since June, 2009.   I have all the same side effects everyone else on this site mentions.  The ones that bother me the most are the hot flashes (one every 40 minutes day and night) the extreme fatigue, and the bone and joint pain ( I have a hard time walking)  I am constantly in a battle with myself, should I stop taking them alltogether and have a better quality of life, or just stick with it because I would really like to see my 21 year old son through grad school etc.  I just wanted to talk to some of you in my position (I feel so bad for all of you).  I don't know one person that is on this that I can talk to in person, because no one I know is on this drug.  I am 56 years old.  I feel about 80 though, with the limitations from this drug.  Thank you for listening.   I have severe joint pain , too. I am now combining Glucosamine (advanced bone & joint support supplement) ask your pharmacist about this product) I just started tking two tablets daily -food in tummy first -breakfast -after dinner. I will keep you all posted about the effects. I can hardly get out of bed in the morning to get ready for work. Susan
